questions.description: 'Artificial intelligence' is the capacity for computers to perform tasks traditionally thought to involve human intelligence. This can include making predictions, suggesting decisions, or generating text.

questions.prompt: Artificial intelligence helps teachers write or improve lesson plans.
Artificial intelligence enables teachers to adapt learning material to different students’ abilities.
Artificial intelligence assists teachers in supporting students individually.
Artificial intelligence supports students with specific needs (e.g. multilingual learners, students with special education needs).
Artificial intelligence helps teachers automate administrative tasks.
Artificial intelligence enables students to misrepresent others’ work as their own.
Artificial intelligence makes recommendations that may not be appropriate or correct.
Artificial intelligence amplifies biases that reinforce students’ misconceptions.
Artificial intelligence jeopardises the privacy and security of student data.
Artificial intelligence suggests unsuitable pedagogical approaches that teachers would use with students.
